name: Piano
history: The piano was invented in Italy in 1709 by Bartolomeo Cristofori.

name: Guitar
history: The guitar has ancient roots, dating back over 4000 years.

name: Sitar
history: The sitar originated from the Indian subcontinent during the medieval period.

name: Violin
history: The modern violin evolved from earlier stringed instruments in Italy in the 16th century.

name: Djembe
history: The djembe is a rope-tuned skin-covered goblet drum played with bare hands, originally from West Africa.

name: Didgeridoo
history: The didgeridoo is a wind instrument developed by Indigenous Australians of northern Australia.

name: Bagpipes
history: The bagpipes are a wind instrument using enclosed reeds fed from a constant reservoir of air in the form of a bag.

name: Shamisen
history: The shamisen is a three-stringed traditional Japanese musical instrument.
inventor: Developed from the Chinese instrument sanxian

name: Accordion
history: The accordion is a box-shaped musical instrument that is played by compressing or expanding the bellows while pressing buttons or keys.

name: Tabla
history: The tabla is a pair of twin hand drums from the Indian subcontinent, used in traditional, classical, popular and folk music.

name: Balalaika
history: The balalaika is a Russian stringed musical instrument with a characteristic triangular body.

name: Oud
history: The oud is a short-neck lute-type, pear-shaped stringed instrument with 11 or 13 strings grouped in 5 or 6 courses.

name: Harp
history: The harp is a stringed musical instrument that has a number of individual strings running at an angle to its soundboard.
inventor: Unknown, dates back to Ancient Egypt

name: Kora
history: The kora is a 21-string lute-bridge-harp used extensively in West Africa.
